events.notes: Zine and print resource center with free collage nights and workshops
events.practical_tips: Resource center for zines, books, prints, and comics. Home to 9,000+ zine library. Offers letterpress, screen printing, risograph, and bookbinding workshops. Collage Night is beginner-friendly.

events.title: Slamlandia Poetry Open Mic
events.address: Various - Guilder Cafe and Literary Arts, Portland

programs.name: Open Mic at Guilder Cafe
programs.notes: Inside Powell's Books downtown. Poets get 3 minutes. First-come, first-served signup. $5 suggested donation.

programs.name: Open Mic at Literary Arts
programs.notes: Larger venue downtown. Features slam competition and featured readers.

programs.name: Open Mic at Flour Bloom
programs.notes: Poetry open mic and slam. Check website for details.

events.notes: Supportive poetry open mic with both intimate and larger venue options
events.practical_tips: Poetry slam and open mic. Poets get 3 minutes on mic. Supportive environment for sharing creative work. Arrive early to sign up for open mic slots.

events.title: The Humble Poets' Open Mic
events.address: The Stacks Coffeehouse, 1831 N Killingsworth St, Portland, OR 97217
events.notes: Very welcoming poetry open mic in cozy coffeehouse - great for first-timers
events.practical_tips: Welcoming open mic for poets and storytellers. Musical accompaniments welcome. Cozy coffeehouse setting ideal for those nervous about sharing work for the first time. Very supportive community.

events.title: Willamette Writers

pricing.description: Many free events; membership has benefits

events.schedule: Various workshops and critique groups throughout the month
events.notes: Oregon's largest writers' organization with free workshops and critique groups
events.practical_tips: Oregon's largest writers' organization. Free writing workshops and drop-in critiques available. Annual conference in August. Good for connecting with other writers at all levels.

events.title: Cathedral Park Jazz Festival
events.address: Cathedral Park, N Edison St & Pittsburg Ave, Portland, OR 97203
events.notes: Longest-running free jazz/blues festival west of the Mississippi. All-volunteer Jazz Society of Oregon. Alcohol restricted to beer garden; family-friendly.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for best lawn spots. Enter from N Edison St entrance.
practical_tips.registration: None - just show up
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blanket or lawn chairs, picnic food (no outside alcohol), sunscreen, layers for evening
practical_tips.good_to_know: Longest-running free jazz/blues festival west of the Mississippi (45 years). Stunning setting under St. Johns Bridge. Food vendors on site. Beer garden for 21+. Family-friendly with kids' area. Three full days of music.

events.title: Noon Tunes at Pioneer Courthouse Square
events.notes: 33+ years of free lunchtime concerts. 17 concerts per season. Presented by 101.9 KINK. Food vendors on site. Art in The Park activities.

practical_tips.first_visit: Just show up at noon. Brick steps provide seating.
practical_tips.registration: None - free and open to all
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Lunch or buy from food vendors. Sunscreen for sunny days.
practical_tips.good_to_know: 33+ years of free lunchtime concerts. Perfect for downtown workers or visitors. Tuesdays and Thursdays noon-1pm, June-July. Food vendors on site. Art in The Park activities. Easy MAX access to Pioneer Courthouse Square.

events.title: Portland Rose Festival
events.notes: 60+ events over 3 weeks. 500,000+ attend Grand Floral Parade.

practical_tips.first_visit: Grand Floral Parade is free along the route - stake out a spot early on downtown streets
practical_tips.registration: None for most events - some require tickets
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Chair/blanket for parade viewing, sunscreen, water
practical_tips.good_to_know: 60+ events over 3 weeks. Grand Floral Parade (500,000+ attend) is free along the route. Free Navy Fleet Week ship tours at Waterfront Park. Dragon Boat Races free to watch from waterfront. Many events are family-friendly.

events.title: Portland Pride

pricing.description: Suggested $10 donation - no one turned away

events.notes: One of largest donation-based LGBTQIA2S+ Pride events on west coast. Moved from June to July in 2023 to avoid conflicts with Juneteenth and Delta Park Powwow. Run by Pride Northwest.

practical_tips.first_visit: Enter at any Waterfront Park entrance. Donation suggested but not required.
practical_tips.registration: None - just show up
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Sunscreen, water, cash for vendors. Rainbow attire welcome!
practical_tips.good_to_know: One of largest donation-based Pride events on west coast - no one turned away. $10 suggested donation but truly pay what you can. Parade Sunday 11am. Festival Sat noon-8pm, Sun 11:30am-6pm. Live music, vendors, community organizations. Very welcoming and celebratory atmosphere.

events.title: First Thursday Art Walk
events.notes: Since 1986. Dozens of galleries with free receptions. Street Gallery runs April-October on NW 13th Ave (100+ artists, 4 blocks).

practical_tips.first_visit: Start at any Pearl District gallery - most along NW 12th-13th between Burnside and Lovejoy
practical_tips.registration: None - just walk in
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing required. Comfortable walking shoes helpful.
practical_tips.good_to_know: Since 1986 - Portland's original art walk. Dozens of galleries with free receptions, wine, and snacks. Street Gallery (April-October) adds 100+ artists on NW 13th Ave. Easy MAX access to Galleria/SW 10th. Great for experiencing Portland's art scene free.

events.title: Last Thursday on Alberta
events.schedule: Last Thursday monthly (year-round); street closures 6-9pm June-August
events.notes: Since 1997. 27 years of community-driven arts. Year-round gallery openings indoors. Free vending for local artists (no permit needed).

practical_tips.first_visit: Start anywhere along Alberta between 15th and 30th Ave
practical_tips.registration: None - just show up
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for street vendors and food carts. Comfortable shoes for walking.
practical_tips.good_to_know: 27 years of community-driven arts in NE Portland. Street closures June-August (6-9pm) create pedestrian festival atmosphere. Year-round gallery openings indoors. Local artists can vend free - no permit needed. Unique Portland experience.

events.title: Portland Tree Lighting Ceremony
events.address: Pioneer Courthouse Square, 701 SW 6th Ave, Portland
events.notes: Since 1984. 75-foot tree donated by Stimson Lumber. Pink Martini sing-along, 10,000 lights. 2025 was 41st annual.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for best viewing spot on the square's brick steps
practical_tips.registration: None - free and open to all
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Warm clothes, hot drinks welcome
practical_tips.good_to_know: Since 1984 - Portland's official holiday kickoff. 75-foot tree with 10,000 lights. Pink Martini sing-along tradition. Arrives day after Thanksgiving. Right at MAX lines - easy transit access.

events.title: Peacock Lane Holiday Lights
events.address: SE 39th Ave between Belmont & Stark, Portland
events.notes: Since 1932 (93 years). Historic Tudor homes. 2032 will be 100th anniversary.

practical_tips.first_visit: Visit on pedestrian-only nights (Dec 19-20) for best experience - no car traffic
practical_tips.registration: None - just show up
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Warm clothes, walking shoes. Cash for cocoa booth donations.
practical_tips.good_to_know: Since 1932 - 93 years of tradition. Historic Tudor homes decorated with classic lights. Free cocoa booth Dec 15-24. Pedestrian-only nights Dec 19-20 recommended. Take TriMet - no official parking. 2032 will be 100th anniversary.

events.title: Gresham Wednesday Music in the Parks

programs.name: Music in the Parks
programs.notes: July-August at Nadaka Nature Park, Bella Vista Park, Butler Creek Park, Vance Park; 2026 dates TBA

practical_tips.first_visit: Check greshamoregon.gov/Recreation for current schedule and locations
practical_tips.registration: None - free and open to all
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blanket or lawn chairs, picnic food, bug spray
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free summer concerts at rotating Gresham parks July-August. Every other Wednesday 6:30-8:30pm. Great family-friendly neighborhood events. Check schedule for park locations.

pricing.description: $16 weekday / $21 weekend adults; Children 12 and under FREE
pricing.notes: Online tickets only; best bloom mid-April

practical_tips.first_visit: Buy tickets online only - no gate sales. Weekdays less crowded.
practical_tips.registration: Online ticket purchase required at woodenshoe.com
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Camera, comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, cash for food vendors
practical_tips.good_to_know: 40 acres of tulips in Willamette Valley. Peak bloom typically mid-April (weather dependent). Children 12 and under free. Seniors 65+ get discount. Food vendors on site. About 45 min from Portland.

events.title: Spring Garden Fair
events.address: Clackamas County Fairgrounds, 694 NE 4th Ave, Canby, OR
events.notes: Free parking and free soil pH testing with admission.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for best plant selection
practical_tips.registration: Pay at gate
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Wagon or cart for purchases, cash, sunscreen
practical_tips.good_to_know: Largest plant sale in the region. Kids under 16 free. Two-day pass available if you want to return. Master Gardener advice available. In Canby - about 30 min from Portland.

events.title: Gresham Arts Festival
events.notes: 150+ artists, kids village, live music, food trucks

practical_tips.first_visit: Main stage area is in downtown Gresham near Main City Park
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food/art purchases, sunscreen, water
practical_tips.good_to_know: 150+ artists, kids village, live music, food trucks. Free family-friendly event in downtown Gresham. One of the region's largest free arts festivals.

events.title: India Festival
events.address: Pioneer Courthouse Square, 701 SW 6th Ave, Portland, OR
events.notes: 10,000+ attendees, Indian dance, music, food

practical_tips.first_visit: Enter from any side of Pioneer Courthouse Square
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food vendors, appetite for Indian food!
practical_tips.good_to_know: 10,000+ attendees celebrate Indian culture through dance, music, and food. All-day free event 10am-8pm. Excellent authentic food vendors. Central downtown location with easy MAX access.

events.title: Obon Festival (Oregon Buddhist Temple)
events.address: Oregon Buddhist Temple, 3720 SE 34th Ave, Portland, OR 97202
events.notes: Japanese Buddhist festival, all welcome. Free dance practices held beforehand; no experience needed

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive by 7pm for Bon Odori dancing - no experience needed
practical_tips.registration: None - free and open to all
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food, comfortable shoes for dancing
practical_tips.good_to_know: Japanese Buddhist festival honoring ancestors - all welcome regardless of faith. Free dance practices held beforehand. Bon Odori circle dancing starts 7pm - everyone can join! Traditional food, taiko drums, cultural exhibits. Warm, welcoming community event.

events.title: Swan Island Dahlias
events.notes: Free parking. Festival includes classes, food carts, live music on Sat/Sun, Sunday Market. Over 50 years running.

practical_tips.first_visit: Drive to Canby - about 30 min from Portland. Open Wed-Sun + Labor Day.
practical_tips.registration: None - free entry
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Camera, cash for flower purchases, sunscreen, comfortable shoes
practical_tips.good_to_know: 40 acres of dahlias with 400+ varieties - one of world's largest growers. Free to walk through fields. Peak bloom late August-September. Buy cut flowers or tubers to grow at home. Peaceful, uncrowded experience.

events.title: Clackamas County Fair
events.notes: Carnival, PRCA rodeo, livestock, multiple entertainment stages

practical_tips.first_visit: Check for discount admission days early in the week
practical_tips.registration: Buy tickets at gate or online
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food/games, comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen
practical_tips.good_to_know: Classic county fair with carnival rides, PRCA rodeo, livestock exhibits, multiple entertainment stages. Early-week discount days available. In Canby - about 30 min from Portland.

events.title: Portland Polish Festival
events.address: Polish Hall, 3900 N Interstate Ave, Portland, OR 97227
events.notes: Longest-running Polish festival on West Coast. Dates estimated based on typical mid-September weekend; confirm closer to event.

practical_tips.first_visit: Located at Polish Hall on N Interstate Ave
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food and crafts, appetite for pierogies!
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free Polish cultural festival with traditional food (pierogies, kielbasa), folk dancing, music, crafts. Indoor venue at historic Polish Hall. Welcoming community atmosphere.

events.title: Portland Greek Festival
events.address: Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Cathedral, 3131 NE Glisan St, Portland, OR
events.notes: 72nd annual in 2025; 15,000+ guests annually

practical_tips.first_visit: Located at Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Cathedral on NE Glisan
practical_tips.registration: Pay $5 at door (kids under 12 free)
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food (gyros, baklava!), comfortable shoes for dancing
practical_tips.good_to_know: 3-day festival of Greek food, music, and dancing. Cathedral tours available. Amazing food - gyros, souvlaki, baklava. Watch or join traditional Greek dancing. Festive, welcoming atmosphere.

events.title: Día de los Muertos (Gresham)
events.address: Gresham Arts Plaza, 401 NE 2nd St, Gresham, OR

practical_tips.first_visit: Located at Gresham Arts Plaza downtown
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Photos of loved ones to add to community ofrenda if desired, cash for food
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free celebration of Mexican tradition honoring departed loved ones. Community ofrenda (altar), traditional food, music, sugar skull decorating. All welcome to participate and learn about this meaningful cultural celebration.

events.title: Happy Valley Fourth of July Festival
events.address: Happy Valley Park, 13770 SE Ridgecrest Rd, Happy Valley, OR
events.notes: Independence Day hike at 9:30am, parade at noon. Beer garden, carnival rides (wristbands), food vendors.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for parking at Happy Valley Park
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blankets, chairs, picnic food, sunscreen
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free community Fourth of July celebration. Live music, food vendors, kids activities. Fireworks typically at dusk. Great neighborhood event in Happy Valley.

events.title: Concerts in the Valley (Happy Valley)
events.address: Happy Valley Park, 13770 SE Ridgecrest Rd, Happy Valley, OR

programs.name: Thursday Concert
programs.notes: July-August; 2026 dates TBA (check website in June)

practical_tips.first_visit: Happy Valley Park location - arrive early for best lawn spots
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blankets, lawn chairs, picnic food
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free Thursday evening concerts July-August, 6:30-8:30pm. 27th season in 2025. "Happy Zone" kids activity area added. Family-friendly community event.

events.title: Happy Valley Oktoberfest
events.address: Happy Valley Park, Happy Valley, OR
events.notes: Date estimated based on typical first-Saturday-of-October pattern; confirm closer to event.

practical_tips.first_visit: Happy Valley Park location
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food/beer vendors
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free community Oktoberfest celebration with German food, beer garden, live music. Family-friendly with kids activities. Great fall neighborhood event.

events.title: Happy Valley Tree Lighting
events.address: 16000 SE Misty Dr, Happy Valley, OR
events.notes: Date estimated based on typical first-Monday-of-December pattern; confirm closer to event.

practical_tips.first_visit: Located at Happy Valley City Hall area
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Warm clothes, hot drinks welcome
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free community tree lighting ceremony to kick off the holiday season. Hot cocoa, caroling, Santa visit. Family-friendly neighborhood celebration.

events.title: Portland Saturday Market

programs.name: Saturday Market
programs.notes: March through December; live music at 11am and 2pm

programs.name: Sunday Market
programs.notes: March through December

events.notes: Largest continuously operating outdoor arts market in the U.S., 250+ vendors

practical_tips.first_visit: Enter from Waterfront Park - market stretches under Burnside Bridge
practical_tips.registration: None - free admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash (some vendors cash-only), reusable bags for purchases
practical_tips.good_to_know: Largest continuously operating outdoor arts market in the U.S. 250+ vendors selling handmade crafts, art, and food. Live music at 11am and 2pm. Free to browse - no pressure to buy. Great people-watching and local culture experience.

practical_tips.first_visit: Find a fishing spot - many stocked ponds in Portland metro area
practical_tips.registration: None - no license required on free weekends
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Fishing gear (rod, tackle, bait), bucket/cooler, sunscreen
practical_tips.good_to_know: No fishing license required statewide on these weekends. Three times per year (February, June, November). All other fishing regulations still apply (size/bag limits). Great introduction to fishing without cost of license.

events.title: Christmas Ships Parade
events.address: Columbia and Willamette Rivers, Portland, OR
events.notes: 15 nights of decorated boats on the rivers

practical_tips.first_visit: Check christmasships.org for nightly schedule showing which river section the fleet will be on
practical_tips.registration: None - free to watch from anywhere along the river
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Warm clothes, hot drinks, blankets if sitting riverside
practical_tips.good_to_know: 15 nights of decorated boats parading on the Columbia and Willamette Rivers. Free to view from any riverfront location. Fleet visits different areas each night - check schedule. Restaurants along the river offer viewing with dinner. Magical Portland holiday tradition.

events.title: Gresham Movies in the Park
events.notes: Free outdoor movie series since 2022. Coordinated with Troutdale's program for more options.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early to secure good spot - events start at 6:30pm
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blankets, lawn chairs, snacks
practical_tips.good_to_know: New LED technology allows earlier start times and double features

events.title: Lake Oswego Summer Concerts
events.address: Millennium Plaza Park, Lake Oswego, OR
events.schedule: Various dates (typically Thursday evenings); 2026 schedule TBA
events.notes: Free outdoor concert series with local musicians.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for good seating
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Picnic blankets, low-back chairs, food/drinks
practical_tips.good_to_know: Local musicians; family-friendly atmosphere

events.title: Tualatin Concerts in the Parks
events.address: Tualatin Community Park, 8515 SW Tualatin Rd
events.notes: Free outdoor summer concert series featuring diverse music genres.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for good spot on the lawn
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blankets, low chairs, picnic food (no food sold at venue)
practical_tips.good_to_know: ADA parking at Atfalati Park and Tualatin Community Park lots

events.title: Cascade Festival of African Films
events.address: Hollywood Theatre, 4122 NE Sandy Blvd, Portland, OR 97212

pricing.description: FREE - all screenings free to public
pricing.notes: Oldest and longest-running African film festival in the US

events.notes: Free 5-week celebration of African cinema during Black History Month. 36 years running. Community discussions after films.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check schedule online - different films each weekend
practical_tips.good_to_know: Shows Africa through African filmmakers' eyes, not Western perspective. Volunteer-run.

events.title: Jade International Night Market

pricing.notes: Food and vendor purchases separate

events.notes: Portland's largest multicultural night market celebrating Jade District's diverse Asian and immigrant communities. Founded 2014.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early for parking; bring cash for vendors
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash, comfortable shoes
practical_tips.good_to_know: Very crowded - plan for large crowds. Great food variety.

events.title: Forest Park
events.notes: 5,200 acres, 80+ miles of trails
events.practical_tips: 5,200 acres with 80+ miles of trails. Lower Macleay has ADA-accessible 0.2-mile paved segment. Take bus 15/26/77 to Lower Macleay or MAX to Oregon Zoo for Wildwood Trail. Quieter on weekday mornings.

events.title: Smith and Bybee Wetlands Natural Area
events.notes: Largest urban freshwater wetland in US (2,000 acres). Very few visitors - good for social anxiety.
events.practical_tips: Largest urban freshwater wetland in US (2,000 acres). Very few visitors - excellent for social anxiety. Paved 0.9-mile Interlakes Trail is fully accessible with two viewing platforms. Bus #11 to N. Marine Drive. Dawn to dusk.

events.title: Tryon Creek State Natural Area

pricing.notes: Free if arriving by foot, bike, or bus

programs.name: Saturday Guided Nature Walks
programs.notes: One-hour guided hike with a park naturalist. Topics vary weekly - fungi, wildlife, seasonal themes. Ages 5+ (all ages welcome). No registration - meet at Nature Center.

events.practical_tips: Park FREE; parking $10/day starting Oct 2025 (free if arriving by foot, bike, or bus #35). Trillium Trail is 0.25 mile paved and fully accessible. Free Saturday guided nature walks at 10am. Nature Center 9am-4pm daily.

events.title: Powell Butte Nature Park
events.notes: 611 acres, 360-degree views from meadow summit. Weekday mornings quieter.
events.practical_tips: FREE entry. 611 acres with 360-degree views from meadow summit. Visitor Center open Wed-Sun 9am-3pm. Bus #9 or #74. Weekday mornings are quieter. Mix of open meadow and forested trails.

events.title: Oaks Bottom Wildlife Refuge
events.notes: Portland's first wildlife refuge, 175+ bird species, very few visitors
events.practical_tips: Portland's first wildlife refuge with 175+ bird species. Very few visitors - excellent for anxiety. FREE entry. Near Sellwood neighborhood. Good for birding and quiet walks. Mostly flat trails.

events.title: Cooper Mountain Nature Park
events.notes: Opened 2009. Owned by Metro, maintained by THPRD. Views of Chehalem Mountains and Tualatin Valley.
events.practical_tips: FREE entry with 231 acres and 3+ miles of trails. 3/4-mile wheelchair-accessible loop. Nature-inspired playground. Nature House programs available. No dogs/pets allowed. Views of Chehalem Mountains. Usually quiet.

events.title: Oxbow Regional Park
events.notes: Old-growth forest with 700-year-old trees
events.practical_tips: Old-growth forest with 700-year-old trees. $5/car or $40 annual pass. 16+ free days annually - check Metro website. Fee waivers available for programs (~$6/person). Guided hikes, campfire programs, mushroom walks offered.

events.title: Tualatin River National Wildlife Refuge
events.notes: Est. 1992. 900+ acres. 200+ bird species. Part of Tualatin River NWR Complex with Wapato Lake NWR. Flagship urban refuge.
events.practical_tips: FREE entry and all programs free. Visitor Center Tue-Sun 10am-4pm. Trails dawn to dusk. Wetland Trail open May-Sept only. Programs include Puddle Stompers (ages 2-5), Owl Prowl, ranger-led hikes. 200+ bird species.

events.title: Hoyt Arboretum

programs.name: Free Public Tours
programs.notes: Sign up day-of at Visitor Center

programs.name: Free Volunteer-Led Hikes
programs.notes: Up to 4 miles, mixed terrain

events.notes: Living museum of trees. Trail maps in English and Spanish.
events.practical_tips: Grounds FREE, parking $2/hour or $8/day. Free public tours Sundays 11am April-October. Free shuttle stops at Visitor Center. Trail maps in English and Spanish. Living museum of trees. Visitor Center open 10am-4pm daily.

events.title: Bird Alliance of Oregon (formerly Portland Audubon)
events.notes: Name changed from Portland Audubon in Feb 2024. Upper Macleay in Forest Park (adjacent) is dog-friendly.
events.practical_tips: FREE 172-acre Wildlife Sanctuary with 4+ miles of trails. Loaner binoculars and field guides available. Free bird walks year-round. No dogs allowed. Dawn to dusk. Adjacent to Forest Park. Great for birding beginners.

events.title: Gresham Free Splash Pads
events.practical_tips: FREE splash pads at Gresham Arts Plaza (10am-10pm) and Rockwood Plaza (8am-9pm). Seasonal May-September. Bring towels and sunscreen. Good for cooling off on hot days. Both locations have other amenities nearby.

events.title: Blue Lake Regional Park Disc Golf Course
events.address: 21199 NE Blue Lake Rd, Fairview, OR 97024
events.practical_tips: FREE 18-hole championship-level disc golf course. Parking $5 or $40 annual Metro pass. Bring your own discs. Can be busy on weekends. Good exercise and can be done solo. Beautiful lakeside setting.

events.title: Main City Park (Gresham)

programs.name: Summer Kids in the Park (SKIP)
programs.notes: Free lunch and recreation for youth

programs.name: Tsuru Island Garden Events
programs.notes: Performances, workshops, monthly bonsai classes

events.notes: Central Gresham park hosting festivals, concerts, and community events. Tsuru Island Japanese Garden maintained by volunteers since 1970s.

practical_tips.first_visit: Don't miss Tsuru Island Japanese Garden within the park
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Picnic supplies; leash for dogs outside off-leash area
practical_tips.good_to_know: Hosts many free community events throughout the year

events.title: Graham Oaks Nature Park
events.practical_tips: FREE entry. Restored oak woodland and wetlands in Wilsonville. Metro nature park with quiet trails. Usually not crowded. Good for nature walks and birding.

events.title: Scouters Mountain Nature Park
events.practical_tips: FREE entry in Happy Valley. Shady trails with Mount Hood views. Metro nature park. Usually quiet. Good for hiking and nature observation.

events.title: Mount Talbert Nature Park
events.practical_tips: FREE entry in Clackamas. Forested trails through second-growth forest. Metro nature park. Usually quiet. Good for moderate hiking.

events.title: Cook Park
events.notes: Largest and most popular park in Tigard, on the Tualatin River. Connects to Fanno Creek Greenway Trail system.

practical_tips.first_visit: Start at main parking lot for playground and butterfly garden access
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Picnic supplies; leash for dogs
practical_tips.good_to_know: New inclusive playground has wheelchair-accessible features and soft surfaces

events.title: Tualatin Community Park
events.notes: Tualatin's main park with excellent facilities including award-winning skate park and river access.

practical_tips.first_visit: Skate park is a highlight - award-winning design
practical_tips.registration: Reserve shelters through City of Tualatin
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Picnic supplies, sports equipment
practical_tips.good_to_know: Lit facilities stay open until 10:30pm

events.title: South Barlow Berries
events.notes: Most accessible option for peer support programs - accepts EBT
events.practical_tips: Accepts Oregon Trail Card (EBT/SNAP), Senior Farm Direct Vouchers, and WIC Vouchers. Seasonal June-August. Bring containers or buckets for berries. Cash or card accepted. Best to arrive early on hot days.

events.title: Columbia Farms U-Pick

pricing.notes: Free pint boxes provided

events.notes: Quiet, non-festival atmosphere - good for calmer environments
events.practical_tips: Quiet, non-festival atmosphere ideal for those who prefer calmer environments. Accepts Farm Direct Vouchers. Free pint boxes provided. 15+ berry varieties. On Sauvie Island. Seasonal June-August.

events.title: Blanchet House of Hospitality
events.notes: Serving since 1952. ~1,200 meals daily. Sit-down indoor dining, vegetarian options, dogs allowed if leashed. Wednesday is spaghetti night. No questions asked.
events.practical_tips: No questions asked - just show up. Sit-down indoor dining with vegetarian options. Dogs allowed if leashed. Wednesday is spaghetti night. Serving since 1952. Downtown Old Town location.

events.title: Sisters of the Road Café

pricing.notes: Barter work program - work 15 minutes for a meal

events.notes: Welcoming community space emphasizing dignity and autonomy
events.practical_tips: Pay-what-you-can or work 15 minutes for a meal through barter program. Welcoming community space emphasizing dignity and autonomy. Downtown Old Town location. A gathering place, not just a meal program.

events.title: Portland Rescue Mission
events.practical_tips: Open 365 days per year. Breakfast at 7am, dinner at 6pm daily. Weekend lunch at 12:30pm. No questions asked. Downtown Old Town/Burnside location. Can be crowded during meal times.

events.title: Sikh Center of Oregon Langar
events.address: 17514 SW Scholls Ferry Rd, Beaverton, OR 97007
events.notes: Free vegetarian meals based on 500-year-old Sikh tradition (Langar). 150-200 people served weekly. All welcome regardless of religion. Remove shoes, cover head (scarves provided). Food served in separate area - no need to attend religious service.
events.practical_tips: Free vegetarian meals Sundays 11am-2:15pm. All welcome regardless of religion. Remove shoes and cover head (scarves provided). Food served in separate area - no need to attend religious service. Gurdwara open daily 7am-9pm.

events.title: Loaves & Fishes Senior Dining Centers

pricing.description: $10.50 suggested donation - pay what you can afford

events.notes: 30+ dining centers operated by Meals on Wheels People
events.practical_tips: For adults 60+ regardless of income. Suggested $10.50 donation but pay what you can afford. Lunches Mon-Thu at various locations throughout Portland metro. Social dining experience. Call ahead to confirm hours at specific location.

events.title: Olson Farms Pumpkin Patch

pricing.notes: Free hayrides

events.notes: Operating since 1906
events.practical_tips: FREE entry with flat-rate pumpkins. Free hayrides included. Operating since 1906. Less commercialized than some pumpkin patches. Good for a simple, traditional fall experience. October only.

events.title: The Pumpkin Patch on Sauvie Island
events.address: 16511 NW Gillihan Road, Sauvie Island, OR
events.practical_tips: FREE entry on Sauvie Island. Corn maze is $8-10 extra. Popular destination - can be crowded on weekends. Good for families. October only. Sauvie Island parking pass may be required.

events.title: SnowCap Community Garden

pricing.description: FREE plots for low-income residents east of 82nd Ave

events.notes: Most plots are handicapped accessible
events.practical_tips: FREE garden plots for low-income residents east of 82nd Ave. Most plots are handicapped accessible. Good therapeutic activity. East Portland location. Apply for a plot through SnowCap Community Charities.

events.title: Outgrowing Hunger
events.address: Rosewood Neighborhood Garden, 17200 SE Alder, Portland, OR

pricing.description: FREE - drop in, farm 2 hours, leave with free produce

events.practical_tips: Drop in and farm for 2 hours, then leave with free produce. No registration needed. At Rosewood Neighborhood Garden in East Portland. Good way to combine exercise with food access. Tools provided.

events.title: Clackamas Service Center
events.notes: Largest food pantry in Clackamas County. Also offers pop-up sites at elementary schools.

practical_tips.first_visit: Bring current piece of mail (within 30 days) as proof of address
practical_tips.what_to_bring: ID and proof of Clackamas County address
practical_tips.good_to_know: Largest food pantry in Clackamas County with 51-year history

events.title: Gleaners of Clackamas County

pricing.description: FREE emergency food; minimal charges for resource center items

events.notes: Member-based, all-volunteer food share organization serving Clackamas County since 1981.

practical_tips.first_visit: Contact to learn about membership and income guidelines
practical_tips.registration: Membership required to access food assistance
practical_tips.good_to_know: All-volunteer organization established in 1981

events.title: Lake Oswego Farmers' Market
events.address: Millennium Plaza Park, Lake Oswego, OR

pricing.notes: SNAP/EBT accepted with matching program

events.notes: May-October season. One of the best farmers' markets for SNAP users due to matching program.

practical_tips.first_visit: SNAP matching booth usually near entrance
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Oregon Trail Card/EBT for SNAP matching
practical_tips.good_to_know: SNAP matching effectively doubles your food budget at the market

events.title: Gresham Farmers' Market
events.address: Arts Plaza, NE 3rd St and NE Hood Ave, Gresham, OR

pricing.ebt: EBT accepted - purple $1 tokens at info booth
pricing.notes: Most produce vendors accept Senior/WIC checks

events.notes: May-October season. One of three markets in Gresham area. EBT purple tokens available at info booth.

practical_tips.first_visit: Info booth near entrance has EBT tokens, ATM, and market information
practical_tips.what_to_bring: EBT card, reusable bags, cash or card for tokens
practical_tips.good_to_know: One of the longest-running farmers markets in the region

events.title: Rockwood Community Market
events.address: Downtown Rockwood Plaza, 458 SE 185th Ave, Gresham, OR
events.notes: June-September season. Evening market serving the diverse Rockwood community.

practical_tips.first_visit: Located in heart of Rockwood neighborhood
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash, reusable bags
practical_tips.good_to_know: Evening market - good for after-work shopping

events.title: Community Farm at Lynwood Friends Church

programs.name: Drop-In Farming
programs.notes: Come farm for 2 hours, leave with a bag of fresh produce. No commitment required.

events.notes: Farm for 2 hours, take home fresh produce. No ongoing commitment required.
events.practical_tips: Drop-in model where anyone can come farm for 2 hours and leave with fresh produce. No commitment required - just show up during open hours. Combines gentle physical activity with tangible reward. Great for those wanting to try gardening.

events.title: Portland Area Board Games Meetup

pricing.description: FREE - just buy food/drink from venue

programs.name: Tuesday Board Games
programs.notes: 20-30 attendees typical. Games provided. All skill levels welcome.

programs.name: Wednesday East Side Game Night
programs.location: Board Bard Games (7960 SE Stark St)
programs.notes: Free weekly social for all levels. Games provided by the shop.

events.notes: Explicitly welcoming to newcomers
events.practical_tips: FREE - just buy food/drink from venue. Tuesdays at CORE Food Carts (82nd Ave, 5pm) and Wednesdays at Board Bard Games (5pm). Explicitly welcoming to newcomers. Games provided. All skill levels welcome. Check Meetup.com/pdxgames for full schedule and additional events.

events.title: Milwaukie Community Center
events.address: 5440 SE Kellogg Creek Dr, Milwaukie, OR 97222

pricing.description: Programs vary; some free, some low-cost

programs.name: Woodcarvers Drop-In
programs.notes: Novice to advanced; guidance for starters

programs.name: Tai Chi for Seniors
programs.notes: Gentle exercise for balance and wellness

programs.name: Congregate Lunch
programs.notes: Social dining for older adults

events.notes: Primary hub for older adults in North Clackamas. Meals on Wheels program delivers 300+ meals daily.

practical_tips.first_visit: Stop by during office hours to get oriented to services
practical_tips.registration: Many programs available through ncprd.org or by calling 503-794-8092
practical_tips.good_to_know: Opened in 1980; comprehensive resource for older adults and families

events.title: Write Around Portland

programs.name: 10-week workshops
programs.locations: Hospitals, shelters, senior centers, treatment facilities
programs.notes: Serves marginalized populations with trauma-informed approach

programs.name: Public Readings
programs.location: First United Methodist Church, 1838 SW Jefferson St

events.practical_tips: FREE 10-week writing workshops with trauma-informed approach. Serves marginalized populations at hospitals, shelters, senior centers, treatment facilities. Public readings at First United Methodist Church. No writing experience needed.

events.title: Friends of Trees
events.schedule: Weekend mornings during planting season (fall through spring)
events.notes: Highly social tree-planting events. No experience needed, all ages welcome.
events.practical_tips: FREE tree-planting events on weekend mornings fall through spring. Gloves, tools, breakfast, coffee/tea provided. Potluck lunch afterward. No experience needed, all ages welcome. Highly social atmosphere.

events.title: SOLVE Oregon

programs.name: Oregon Spring Cleanup
programs.notes: Statewide volunteer cleanup in April. Join thousands of volunteers removing litter from parks, trails, and waterways. Equipment and supplies provided. Register online for a site near you.

programs.name: Beach/Riverside Cleanup
programs.notes: Annual coastal and river cleanup in September. Help remove debris from Oregon's beaches and riverbanks. Equipment provided. Great way to enjoy the outdoors while giving back.

programs.name: Pick It Up, Portland!
programs.notes: Ongoing neighborhood cleanups throughout the year. Flexible scheduling lets you volunteer when it works for you. Equipment provided. Perfect for those wanting regular outdoor volunteer opportunities.

events.practical_tips: FREE environmental cleanups throughout the year. Oregon Spring Cleanup (April), Beach/Riverside Cleanup (September), Pick It Up Portland (year-round). Equipment provided. No experience needed. Good for giving back to community.

events.title: Oregon Food Bank Volunteer Program
events.notes: Team-oriented volunteer shifts
events.practical_tips: FREE team-oriented volunteer shifts Monday-Saturday, 2-3 hours each. Book online at oregonfoodbank.org. Sorting food with other volunteers. Good for those wanting to help fight hunger. Indoor warehouse work.

events.title: Multnomah Arts Center

pricing.description: Pay What You Can options; Access Discount Program applies

events.notes: Sliding-scale arts education
events.practical_tips: Pay What You Can options with Access Discount Program available. Classes in drawing, painting, ceramics, textiles, photography, writing. In SW Portland. Register through Portland Parks. All skill levels welcome.

events.title: Northwest Wools Crafting Compassion

programs.name: Crafting Compassion
programs.notes: Drop-in fiber arts session every Tuesday. Knit, crochet, or try other crafts while chatting with fellow crafters. Projects are donated to charity. Supplies provided or bring your own. All skill levels welcome—beginners encouraged!

events.practical_tips: FREE Crafting Compassion drop-in Tuesdays 3-5pm. Knitting, crocheting, and other fiber arts. Projects donated to charity. Supplies provided or bring your own. All skill levels welcome.

events.title: Puddletown Knitters Guild
events.address: Rose City Park Presbyterian Church, 1907 NE 45th Ave, Portland, OR

programs.name: Monthly Meeting
programs.notes: September through May

events.practical_tips: FREE monthly meetings 2nd Thursday 7-9pm, September through May. At Rose City Park Presbyterian Church. Guild membership available but visitors always welcome. Knitting-focused with programs and presentations.

events.title: Pioneer Community Center

programs.name: Bingo
programs.notes: Cards available for purchase starting at noon. Cards just 25 cents. Great prizes.

programs.name: Fitness Classes
programs.notes: Various classes available

programs.name: Art Classes
programs.notes: Creative programming

events.notes: Serves adults 21 and older. Mission to promote active, healthy, independent living.

practical_tips.first_visit: Multi-purpose center for adults 21+; welcoming atmosphere
practical_tips.registration: Contact center or visit orcity.org for class registration
practical_tips.good_to_know: Has peace garden and park benches; near public transit

events.title: Lake Oswego Adult Community Center

pricing.description: Programs vary; many free or low-cost

programs.name: Creative Hands
programs.notes: Craft activities

programs.name: In Stitches Quilters
programs.notes: Quilting group

programs.name: American Mah Jongg
programs.notes: Weekly game group

programs.name: Pinochle
programs.notes: Card games

programs.name: Scrabble
programs.notes: Word games

programs.name: Duplicate Bridge
programs.notes: Bridge group

programs.name: Computers & Technology
programs.notes: Tech help and classes

programs.name: Trips
programs.notes: Group outings

events.notes: Nationally accredited senior center offering comprehensive services since 1970.

practical_tips.first_visit: First senior center in Clackamas County (est. 1970)
practical_tips.good_to_know: Third senior center nationally to receive accreditation

events.title: Clackamas County ADRC (Aging & Disability Resource Connection)
events.notes: Central hub connecting people to 10+ community adult centers throughout Clackamas County.

practical_tips.good_to_know: Central resource for navigating services for older adults and people with disabilities in Clackamas County

events.title: Tigard Senior Center

pricing.description: FREE activities; lunch $3 suggested donation for 60+
pricing.notes: Meals on Wheels People provides dining program

events.notes: Partnership between City of Tigard and Meals on Wheels People. Welcoming atmosphere with friendly staff and varied programming.

practical_tips.first_visit: Stop by to pick up monthly activity calendar
practical_tips.registration: Most activities are drop-in; some classes may require signup
practical_tips.what_to_bring: ID for meal program; comfortable clothes for exercise
practical_tips.good_to_know: Pool table available 8:30am-5pm daily, plus Tue/Thu evenings

events.title: Elsie Stuhr Center (THPRD)

pricing.description: Drop-in fees vary; many activities free or low-cost
pricing.notes: THPRD Financial Aid available for qualifying residents

programs.name: Fitness Classes
programs.options: Aerobics, Balance, Yoga, Pilates, Tai Chi, Zumba Gold, Essentrics, NeuroFitness, Chair-based classes

programs.name: Recreation & Enrichment
programs.options: Art, dance, enrichment classes, trips and tours

programs.name: Special Events
programs.options: Holiday Bazaar, Elsie Stuhr Day, New Year's Dance, Valentine's Dance

events.notes: THPRD's only recreation center dedicated to 55+ adults. Warm, welcoming community with diverse programming.

practical_tips.first_visit: Take a tour to see all the amenities
practical_tips.registration: Create free THPRD account for class registration
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable clothes for fitness activities
practical_tips.good_to_know: Coffee bar is a great place to meet people and chat

events.title: Juanita Pohl Center (Tualatin Active Aging Center)

pricing.notes: Some fitness classes free with SilverSneakers/Silver&Fit

events.notes: Active aging center with diverse programming from fitness to legal aid. Spanish-language support group available.

practical_tips.first_visit: Stop by for JPC Prime Times calendar of activities
practical_tips.registration: Some classes require registration; many are drop-in
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable clothes for fitness classes
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free legal consultations cover estate planning and elder law

events.title: Repair PDX

pricing.notes: All Repair Cafés and most workshops are free. Bring broken items to be repaired by volunteers.

programs.name: RPDX Repair Café @ Leaven Common House
programs.location: Leaven Community Center, 5431 NE 20th Ave, Portland, OR 97211
programs.notes: Volunteers fix small appliances, bikes, clothing. Tool/knife sharpening and Kintsugi repair available. Registration form recommended.

programs.name: Soldering for Home Electronics Repairs Workshop
programs.location: Leaven Community Center, 5431 NE 20th Ave, Portland, OR 97211
programs.notes: Learn basics of soldering for electronics repair. Check website for dates.

programs.name: Sashiko Mending Workshop
programs.location: Leaven Community Center, 5431 NE 20th Ave, Portland, OR 97211
programs.notes: Traditional Japanese embroidered mending technique. Check website for dates.

events.notes: Operating since 2013. Part of global Repair Café movement promoting sustainability and community connection. Great for learning basic repair skills.

practical_tips.first_visit: Fill out the Google Form before arriving to let them know what you're bringing
practical_tips.registration: Registration form recommended but not required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Broken items (small appliances, bikes, clothing with tears). Items should be portable.
practical_tips.good_to_know: Volunteer fixers donate their time and expertise. Not all items can be fixed but they'll try! Great way to learn repair skills yourself. Coffee and community atmosphere.

events.title: West Linn Repair Fair
events.address: Robinwood Station Community Center, 3706 Cedar Oak Dr, West Linn, OR 97068
events.notes: Clackamas County repair event. Check repairpdx.org/repair-events for additional dates.

practical_tips.first_visit: Just show up with your broken items
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Broken household items that are portable
practical_tips.good_to_know: Run by Clackamas County - great option for Clackamas County residents

events.title: Friends of Lone Fir Cemetery Tours
events.address: Lone Fir Cemetery, SE 26th Ave & SE Stark St, Portland, OR 97214

pricing.notes: Tickets via Square site. Self-guided smartphone tours and PDF downloads are free.

programs.name: Guided Historical Tour
programs.notes: Learn about Portland's founders and regionally-known pioneers. Meet at Soldiers Monument.

programs.name: Stories in Stone – South
programs.notes: Explores southern section of cemetery. Meet at Soldiers Monument.

programs.name: Women's History Tour
programs.notes: Highlights notable women including Terwilliger, McLoughlin, Macleay families. Meet at Soldiers Monument.

events.notes: 501(c)(3) nonprofit preserving cemetery history since 2000. One of Portland's most beautiful and historic green spaces. Final resting place of many Portland pioneers.

practical_tips.first_visit: Meet at the Soldiers Monument near SE 26th & Stark. Arrive 5-10 minutes early.
practical_tips.registration: Purchase tickets online via Square site before the tour
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable walking shoes, water, weather-appropriate clothing. Tours are outdoors.
practical_tips.good_to_know: Portland's oldest cemetery (1855). Beautiful grounds with mature trees. Tours run rain or shine. Free self-guided tours available via smartphone app or downloadable PDFs. Private group tours available for 6+ people.

events.title: Hands On Greater Portland
events.notes: Low-commitment volunteer projects - show up once, no ongoing obligation
events.practical_tips: Done-in-a-day volunteer projects requiring no experience or ongoing commitment. 2-4 hour projects led by trained volunteer leaders. Sign up with two clicks online. Great low-pressure way to contribute and connect with others.

events.title: The Community for Positive Aging

programs.name: Free Legal Aid
programs.notes: Free legal consultations for seniors.

programs.name: Computer Workshops
programs.notes: Learn technology skills in supportive environment.

programs.name: Tax Assistance
programs.notes: Free tax preparation help for seniors.

programs.name: Energy Assistance
programs.notes: Help applying for utility assistance programs.

events.notes: Senior center with free services including legal aid, tax help, and social programs
events.practical_tips: For adults 55+. Offers free legal aid, computer workshops, tax assistance, and energy assistance programs. Social activity groups and wellness programs. Also hosts NAMI peer support groups on 2nd & 4th Sundays.

events.title: NAMI Washington County

programs.name: NAMI Connection Recovery Support Group
programs.notes: Peer-led support groups for adults living with mental health conditions

programs.name: NAMI Family Support Group
programs.notes: Support groups for family members and caregivers

events.notes: Washington County chapter of NAMI. Provides education, support, and advocacy for people affected by mental illness.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website or call for current meeting schedule
practical_tips.registration: Registration may be required for some groups
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing required - just yourself
practical_tips.good_to_know: Part of the national NAMI network. Partners with MHAAO for PeerZone workshops. Serves all of Washington County.

events.title: Alano Club of Portland

programs.name: Recovery Yoga
programs.notes: Yoga classes designed for people in recovery

events.notes: Portland's premier recovery community center with over 100 weekly meetings for various 12-step and secular recovery programs.

practical_tips.first_visit: Just walk in - no appointment needed. Check meeting schedule online first.
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing required
practical_tips.good_to_know: Over 100 weekly meetings including AA, NA, Al-Anon, SMART Recovery, and specialty groups. One of the largest recovery community centers in Portland. Coffee available at most meetings.

events.title: Bridges to Change - Club Hope

programs.name: Recovery Drop-In Center
programs.schedule: Open daily - check website for hours
programs.notes: Safe space for peer connection and support

programs.name: Dual Diagnosis Anonymous (DDA) Meeting
programs.notes: For people with co-occurring mental health and substance use conditions. Peer-led 12-step style meeting.

programs.name: Peer Mentorship
programs.notes: 98% of staff identify as in recovery - peer-led support

practical_tips.first_visit: Drop-in anytime during open hours - no appointment needed
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing required
practical_tips.good_to_know: Staff are peers in recovery themselves. Also operates housing programs and mobile outreach (Acute Care Team). Located in Gresham, serving East Portland and East County.

events.title: Community for Positive Aging

programs.name: Connecting Through Loss (Grief Support)
programs.notes: Grief support group for older adults processing loss

programs.name: Family Caregivers Group
programs.notes: Support for adults 55+ caring for family members

programs.name: Memory Loss Support Group
programs.notes: Support for those experiencing memory loss

events.notes: Multi-service senior center. Hosts NAMI Multnomah meetings. Focused on positive aging with social, wellness, and support programs.

practical_tips.first_visit: Call or email to learn about current support groups
practical_tips.registration: Contact staff to register for groups
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing required
practical_tips.good_to_know: Also hosts NAMI Multnomah in-person meetings on-site. Multi-purpose senior center with various programs including support groups, social activities, and wellness classes.

events.title: Portland Winter Light Festival
events.address: Multiple locations including Pioneer Courthouse Square and Electric Blocks (Central Eastside)
events.notes: Portland's annual winter light art festival. Free citywide event with installations at multiple locations.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website for map of installations and anchor site locations
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Warm clothing - this is an outdoor winter event
practical_tips.good_to_know: 11th anniversary of the festival. Features large-scale interactive art installations, performances, and pop-ups across Portland. Best experienced after dark.

events.title: Good in the Hood Multicultural Festival

pricing.description: FREE (some ticketed events like gospel brunch)

events.notes: Portland's longest-running multicultural festival celebrating diverse communities in North/Northeast Portland.

practical_tips.first_visit: Arrive early on Saturday/Sunday for best parking and seating
practical_tips.registration: None required for general admission
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Sunscreen, lawn chair or blanket, cash for vendors
practical_tips.good_to_know: Portland's largest and longest-running multicultural music and food festival. 2026 theme "Back in Stride Again" with R&B legend Cherrelle and Surface as headliners. Features parade, live music, complimentary haircuts/braiding, puppet shows.

events.title: Washington County Fair
events.address: Washington County Fairgrounds, 801 NE 34th Ave, Hillsboro, OR
events.notes: One of the few county fairs with completely free admission.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website for entertainment schedule and map
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Cash for food and activities, sunscreen, comfortable walking shoes
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free admission makes this one of the best fair values in the region. Features exhibits, entertainment, food vendors, and family activities. Over 100,000 attendees annually.

events.title: Pedalpalooza / Bike Summer
events.notes: Portland's famous summer bike festival. Most rides are free and open to all skill levels.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check the Shift to Bikes calendar for current rides
practical_tips.registration: None required for most rides
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Bike, helmet, lights, water, layers
practical_tips.good_to_know: Portland's season-long cycling festival with 800+ events led by 600+ ride leaders. Includes family-friendly rides, Midnight Mystery Ride, Breakfast on the Bridges, World Naked Bike Ride, and Multnomah County Bike Fair.

events.title: Urban Gleaners Free Food Markets
events.address: 21+ locations in Multnomah and Washington Counties
events.notes: Rescues food before it goes to waste and distributes through 21+ free public markets. Completely barrier-free access.

practical_tips.first_visit: Use the online Food Finder to locate your nearest market
practical_tips.registration: None required (unless Oregon Food Bank affiliated site)
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Bring your own bags, arrive 10-15 minutes early
practical_tips.good_to_know: Markets offer fresh fruits, vegetables, baked goods, dairy, and prepared meals. Food is rescued before it goes to waste. Completely barrier-free - no income verification.

events.title: PDX Free Fridge
events.address: Multiple locations across Portland - see website for map

pricing.description: FREE - Take what you need, leave what you can

events.notes: Community mutual aid project. Take what you need, leave what you can. Fridges cleaned and stocked by volunteers.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check the website map for fridge locations near you
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing - just take what you need
practical_tips.good_to_know: Community-run mutual aid network of fridges and pantries. Fridges contain vegetables, fruit, protein, snacks, cooked meals (labeled with ingredients/date), and sometimes hygiene products. Volunteer-maintained and cleaned daily.

events.title: Hollywood Farmers Market
events.address: NE Hancock & NE 44th Ave, Portland, OR 97213

pricing.description: SNAP/EBT accepted with Double Up Food Bucks match up to $20
pricing.notes: No surcharge for SNAP/EBT transactions

events.notes: One of Portland's best farmers markets with full SNAP/EBT support and Double Up Food Bucks matching.

practical_tips.first_visit: Find the info booth to exchange SNAP benefits for green tokens
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Reusable bags, SNAP/EBT card if using benefits
practical_tips.good_to_know: Operating since 1997. Green tokens available for SNAP in $1 increments. Great for fresh, local produce with no surcharge on EBT. Double Up Food Bucks doubles your purchasing power on fruits and vegetables.

events.title: Meals on Wheels People
events.address: Various dining centers throughout Portland metro

pricing.description: Donation-based (meals provided regardless of ability to pay)
pricing.notes: Each meal costs over $10 to prepare

events.notes: More than a meal service - provides nutrition, connection, and wellness checks for seniors.

practical_tips.first_visit: Call to sign up for home delivery or find your nearest dining center
practical_tips.registration: Required for home delivery
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Nothing for dining centers
practical_tips.good_to_know: Delivers 25,000+ healthy meals weekly. Over 35 dining centers with activities and social connection. Not just food - also provides connection and wellness checks.

events.title: Portland Parks Summer Free For All

programs.name: Free Outdoor Concerts
programs.notes: Various parks. Check website for locations.

programs.name: Free Outdoor Concerts
programs.notes: Various parks. Check website for locations.

programs.name: Free Movies in the Park
programs.notes: Pre-movie performances by local musicians and free popcorn. Movies start at dusk.

events.notes: Portland's flagship summer program with free movies, concerts, and cultural events at parks citywide.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website for schedule and park locations
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Blanket, picnic food, layers for evening
practical_tips.good_to_know: Movies and concerts run all summer at various parks. Closed captioning, sign language interpreters, and FM loop amplifiers available for all events. Great for families.

events.title: Prism Moves
events.address: 4515 NE Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Portland, OR 97211

pricing.description: FREE BIPOC class weekly; sliding scale memberships available

programs.name: BIPOC Community Class
programs.schedule: Once weekly (check website for current day/time)
programs.notes: For BIPOC community only

events.notes: Inclusive nonprofit gym focused on serving underrepresented communities. Free weekly BIPOC class plus sliding scale memberships.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website for class schedule and sign up online
practical_tips.registration: Required - sign up via website
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable workout clothes, water
practical_tips.good_to_know: Nonprofit inclusive strength and conditioning gym intentionally serving women, BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and larger-bodied individuals. Sliding scale makes membership affordable.

events.title: Portland Strength Collective
events.notes: Free weekly community workout open to all levels.

practical_tips.first_visit: Just show up at 9am Saturday - no registration needed
practical_tips.registration: None required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable workout clothes, water, towel
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free all-levels community workout with friendly coaches. Dynamic warm-up, demo of movements, then workout. Coaches offer tips and modifications for all fitness levels.

events.title: The People's Yoga
events.address: 3014 NE Killingsworth St, Portland (Northeast) and 4029 SE Hawthorne, Portland (Southeast)

pricing.description: Scholarship memberships available ($40 contribution with fund covering remainder); free/by-donation classes with teacher trainees

events.notes: Community-supported yoga studio with scholarship memberships funded by other members.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website for scholarship application and class schedule
practical_tips.registration: Required for scholarship membership
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Yoga mat (mats available), comfortable clothes
practical_tips.good_to_know: Community-focused yoga studio where members fund scholarship memberships for others. About 30 scholarship memberships funded monthly. Work/study positions also available in exchange for free membership.

events.title: Fat Girls Hiking Portland
events.notes: Fat-positive, inclusive hiking group founded in Portland. Welcoming to all body types.

practical_tips.first_visit: Check website or social media for upcoming hike schedule
practical_tips.registration: Check listing for each hike
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Sturdy shoes, water, snacks, layers
practical_tips.good_to_know: Founded in Portland. Offers fat-positive, inclusive, and accessible group hikes. All body types welcome. Focus on enjoyment, not pace.

events.title: Adaptive Sports Northwest
events.address: 10541 SE Cherry Blossom Dr, Portland, OR 97216
events.notes: Premier adaptive sports organization in the region. Paralympic Sport Club recognized by Team USA.

practical_tips.first_visit: Contact via email or website to learn about programs
practical_tips.registration: Membership required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Depends on activity
practical_tips.good_to_know: Providing adaptive sports since 1982 for children and adults with physical disabilities in Oregon and SW Washington. Paralympic Sport Club recognized by Team USA.

events.title: Every Body Athletics
events.address: Multiple locations in Beaverton, Tigard, Portland, Hillsboro, Lake Oswego; also via Zoom
events.schedule: Mon-Thu and Sat (check website for specific times/locations)
events.notes: Specialized fitness programs for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. 1:1-2 support ratio with qualified staff.

practical_tips.first_visit: Contact through website to learn about programs and locations
practical_tips.registration: Required
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable workout clothes, water
practical_tips.good_to_know: Specialized adaptive exercises with 1:1-2 teammate support ratio. Staff have Master's degrees in Special Education and doctoral degrees in Occupational Therapy. Scholarships available.

events.title: Friendly House

programs.name: Community Nights
programs.notes: Free access to showers (sign up by 7pm), internet center, fitness room, and classes. Open to everyone.

events.notes: Nonprofit neighborhood center with sliding scale. Multnomah County Senior Center partner. Free Community Nights on Fridays.

practical_tips.first_visit: Stop by or call for class schedule and pricing
practical_tips.registration: Varies by program
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Comfortable clothes for fitness classes
practical_tips.good_to_know: Nonprofit neighborhood center and Multnomah County District Senior Center partner. Community Nights on Fridays offer free facility use. Offers senior case management and LGBTQ senior services.

events.title: TeenForce Program
events.address: Charles Jordan, East Portland, Matt Dishman, Montavilla, Mt. Scott, Southwest Community Centers
events.notes: Free fitness and recreation access for youth ages 10-20 at Portland Parks community centers.

practical_tips.first_visit: Visit any participating community center with ID
practical_tips.registration: Sign up at community center; parental waiver required for ages 14-17 for fitness center
practical_tips.what_to_bring: Photo ID or school ID
practical_tips.good_to_know: Free access to drop-in activities, fitness center, open gym, and special programs at 6 community centers. Great resource for teens to stay active.
